result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel J Stuht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing March 1, 2016 and each 1st of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel J Stuht

records.addlTxt: Per State Debt Collection, no date of death provided

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  State advises the defendant paid up front restitution of $99.88.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and orders fine of $442.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 3-1-16 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Plea hearing at 01-25-2016 08:15 am

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel request adjournment for the defendant to pay up front restitution.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel just received an offer yesterday and case will resolve.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Counsel advises case will resolve.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
$250 Signature Bond shall remain in effect w/same conditions
Plea hearing at 10-21-2015 02:45 pm

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant missed court as was with his girlfriend at a doctor's appointment and misplaced the court notice and did not remember the court date.  State request $250.00 cash bond, counsel advises defendant does not have ability to make cash bond and request an opportunity for a signature bond.  Counsel believes case will resolve at next court date.  Signature bond maintained.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Hearing at 08-05-2015 09:45 am

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Peter Cannon for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court orders $250 Signature Bond w/no contact provision.  Court orders defendant to go to the Public Defender's Office within 48 hours.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:45 am.
In custody

from defendant at 8:56 a.m. indicating cannot appear as does not have a car.  Court tried to call back at 2:18 p.m. and voice mailbox not set up.  Defendant left another message at 2:12 p.m. with a different phone number but also indicated he was told it would be ok to reset and didn't want his life messed up due to a technicality.  No voice mail at this number.
Def, Joel J Stuht not appearing.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case called at 11:65 a.m.
